The 25 Best Business Schools in the U.S. to Get an MBA Written by: Caroline Nolan 08/14/15 - 8:44 AM EDT 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Making the decision to pursue a degree in higher education can be difficult for anyone, especially because of the high cost that can come with it. For many people looking to pursue or advance a career in finance, the benefits of attending business school outweigh the costs. 
With so many business schools in the country, where can anyone begin to look? U.S. News and World Report has ranked 126 of 464 full-time masterâ€™s programs in business using surveys collected in the fall of 2014 and early 2015. 
These rankings are based on the weighted average of a number of indicators, including placement success, student selectivity, graduate employment rates, and recruiter assessment. More Headlines
